author: dragoniteVS
body: I agree, they've been making some sexy moves with their cash pile. Seems like they want to start corning the gaming market.

author: friendshabitsfamily
body:
People are seriously sleeping on Corning (GLW) — 170-year old glass company that has a fat new contract with Apple to cover all their latest iPhones, and the CEO sits on the board of Amazon.

I’d also wager they’ll be in strong contention for any contract for the glass to hold vaccine doses when the time comes. 

Earnings in two weeks, now’s the time to hop aboard. The stock doesn’t move a ton day to day, but it’s definitely a steady riser.

author: friendshabitsfamily
body: I’m convinced that Corning (GLW) is the absolute safest bet on the market right now. It’s a 170-year-old glass company that has fat contracts with AAPL and whose CEO sits on the board of Amazon. Plus I’d bet they’ll be among any bidders for the glass used to hold COVID vaccines when the time comes.

author: Fragglepusss
body: Don't start with options, don't buy anything with a market cap under 1B. I like TSM, BIDU, AVGO, BIIB, GLW, JNJ, BLK, LMT right now. If you have satellite radio then listening to the CNBC simulcast on your morning commute will help you gain literacy. Mad Money can also be listened to as a podcast.

author: Art0002
body:
I’ll throw this out there ...

Some dude (I’m not sure if it is a company) that can load syringes with the vaccine so they some off the assembly line in some sort of belt fashion ready to use. I can’t remember where I saw it. But it was impressive. 

I think that is the future of vaccines but I’m not an expert. I don’t know about shelf life or anything. Storage methods? I don’t know. 

I don’t think the virus will end soon. I think it will be around for a while and change (some) peoples behaviors forever. Not all. 

With that said, GLW chart looks good. They have recovered from the March lows and then some. They seem to be forming a base around 34 for the last few weeks and will either move up or down. 

They recovered to ~26 in June and then moved up to 34. That is a big swing so there will be a lot of sellers (profit takers). 

PE is 256.

author: skeleman547
body:
No other competitor is able to operate at the scale Corning does. They're a sector leader and create their glass products from silica to fiber optic cable. No other company is able to satisfy the demand placed by this industry right now. The only real threat they face currently (aside from COVID breakouts in the plant) is starlink systems. As much as this sub (and myself) love Musk, it is realistically several years away from being even moderately threatening to traditional FTTH networks. 

Combine that with other companies subcontracting their fiber manufacturing to Corning to meet demand, and you have a recipe for success.

author: Boston_Bruins37
body:
GLW - This is my stable dividend producer with some growth in it, ill sit back and collect a 2.5% dividend that the company continues to raise yearly

MTCH - online dating will only rise, and hinge is growing rapidly into a beast alongside tinder

NET - honestly if FSLY was in the 80s still i would go with that, but I see NET as more fairly valued as of monday, they both have room to grow

V - this pandemic has increased the use of credit cards which will only continue. This company is a machine

DIS - this company is IMO long overdue for a huge growth cycle. As they continue to produce original shows and add more content to DIS+ over the next 10 years I hope it starts getting valued more like a tech company. I would love to see them spin off ESPN though to maximize the DIS brand

author: TheTigersAreNotReal
body:
Not even close to what I was saying. I had suspected it was going to form a cup and handle on Thursday. Which is why I anticipated a drop today, which forms the handle. If I had bought at the bottom of the cup, there was no way of knowing whether it was forming a cup or about to trade flat or drop. Right now is the best time to buy in since there’s a stronger probability of it completing the formation. Once it pushes through the resistance, it will go up by the difference between the resistance (~$13.80 for GME) and the bottom of the cup (~$11.80), which is $2. So anticipate GME reaching at least $15.80 this week. Just look at the cup and handle formed by GLW between July 28th and August 12th. 

Right now is when you buy, it’s definitely not too late.
